subject: [Lab 08] Q7: Advanced Counter
content:
Q7: Advanced Counter

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q7: Advanced Counter in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: gl = 0         n = 0         def counter(input):             nonlocal n , gl             if input == 'count':                 n += 1                 return x             if input == 'global-count':                 gl += 1                 return gl             if input =='reset':                 n = 0             if input =='global-reset':                 gl = 0         return counter(input)     can someone explain why this gives me a 'NoneType' object is not callable while the provided solution works?

follow-ups.feedback: make_advanced_counter_maker doesn't return a counter. It returns a function that makes a counter.  Also, you shouldn't be calling counter at the end of your function. There's a difference between returning a function and returning the call of a function (the latter is what you're doing).
